abstract: We show that many non-MSO1 NP-hard graph problems can be solved in polynomial time on clique-width and NLC-width bounded graphs using a very general and simple scheme. Our examples are partition into cliques, partition into triangles, partition into complete bipartite subgraphs, partition into perfect matchings, partition into forests, cubic subgraph, Hamiltonian path, minimum maximal matching, and vertex/edge separation problems.
